channel.title: Tags on Steve Pulec
channel.description: Recent content in Tags on Steve Pulec

item.title: Small teams
item.description: Patrick Collison has a great list of people quickly accomplishing ambitious things. Inspired by that, I created a page of impressive things accomplished by small teams. Instagram had 13 employees when they were acquired by Facebook for $1 billion. They had 30 millions users at the time. Source Mojang (the company behind Minecraft) had 37 employees when they were acquired by Microsoft for $2.5 billion. At that time, Mojang had revenue of about $290 million annually with profits of over $100 million.

item.title: What Software Developers Can Learn From Fish and Chips
item.description: I love a good plate of fish and chips. I also love a good chance to compare the software development field to a completely separate industry. It’s a great way to find solutions to problems that have been solved decades ago in other fields (genealogy for example) and it helps to keep me grounded in the good ‘ol practical reality. I came across a great example of this today while watching Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives with Guy Fieri.
